column4: Alkermes' schizophrenia drug Aristada gets FDA nod
column5: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Monday approved Alkermes Plc's longer-acting injectable version of blockbuster schizophrenia pill Abilify  making the treatment available in two doses.

column4: Russia says Google must correct contracts with mobile manufacturers by November 18

column5: Oct 5 Google  which has now morphed into holding company Alphabet Inc  took a stake in Symphony Communication Services LLC in a fundraising round that values the messaging startup at $650 million  the Wall Street Journal reported.

column5: MOSCOW  Oct 5 Russia's anti-monopoly agency said on Monday that Google Inc must correct its contracts with mobile manufacturers by Nov. 18  Interfax news agency reported.

column4: Pilot falls ill on American flight from Phoenix to Boston  dies
column5: Oct 5 An overnight flight from Phoenix to Boston was diverted to Syracuse  New York  on Monday morning after one of the pilots fell ill and died  an American Airlines spokeswoman said.

column4: Pacific trade deal adds to U.S. price quandary for biotech drugs
column5: NEW YORK/ATLANTA  Oct 5 The Pacific trade deal agreed on Monday  which grants biotechnology drug producers less protection than offered by the United States  could put more downward pressures on the costly drugs' pricing in the industry's most lucrative market.

column4: VMware shares pare gains after report Apple not renewing licensing agreement

column4: Clinton blasts Patriot Coal bankruptcy plan
column5: Davie  FLORIDA U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton said Friday that a bankruptcy plan proposed by Patriot Coal Corp. is "outrageous and must be stopped" because it diverts money intended for coal miners' retirement benefits.

column4: HKEx says no change to listing rules that drove Alibaba IPO away
column5: HONG KONG  Oct 5 The Hong Kong stock exchange said on Monday it would not seek to change listing rules that were one of the main reasons that drove Alibaba Group Holding  to list its $25 billion initial public offering in New York and not Hong Kong last year.

column4: South Africa's last bullion bluechip battles relegation
column5: JOHANNESBURG  Oct 5 The Johannesburg stock market  the capitalist heart of South Africa's 'City of Gold'  is close to relegating the last bullion producer in its bluechip index  the latest sign of the precious metal losing its place in an economy it once dominated.

column4: U.S. says BP to pay $20 billion in fines for 2010 oil spill
column5: BP Plc will pay more than $20 billion in fines to resolve nearly all claims from its deadly Gulf of Mexico oil spill five years ago  marking the largest corporate settlement of its kind in U.S. history  Attorney General Loretta Lynch said on Monday.

column4: Nelson Peltz's Trian takes $2.5 billion stake in General Electric
column5: Activist investor Nelson Peltz's fund has bought a $2.5 billion stake in General Electric Co  adding fresh pressure on the U.S. conglomerate to pull off its plan to shift away from finance operations toward its industrial roots. | Video

column4: Arkansas teachers top off a sweet day for Peltz' Trian hedge fund
column5: BOSTON Billionaire fund manager Nelson Peltz on Monday added a big new client when he took in $150 million in cash from the Arkansas Teachers Retirement System  part of a trio of welcome victories for the activist  whose portfolio has faced a bumpy ride lately.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 4-Nelson Peltz's Trian Fund takes $2.5 bln stake in GE

column4: Nelson Peltz's Trian takes $2.5 billion stake in General Electric
column5: Activist investor Nelson Peltz's fund has bought a $2.5 billion stake in General Electric Co  adding fresh pressure on the U.S. conglomerate to pull off its plan to shift away from finance operations toward its industrial roots. | Video

column4: Arkansas teachers top off a sweet day for Peltz' Trian hedge fund
column5: BOSTON Billionaire fund manager Nelson Peltz on Monday added a big new client when he took in $150 million in cash from the Arkansas Teachers Retirement System  part of a trio of welcome victories for the activist  whose portfolio has faced a bumpy ride lately.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 4-Nelson Peltz's Trian Fund takes $2.5 bln stake in GE
column5: Oct 5 Nelson Peltz's Trian Fund Management said it bought $2.5 billion in shares of General Electric Co  since May  making it one of the top 10 shareholders in the industrial conglomerate.

column4: GE to sell corporate aircraft financing business
column5: General Electric Co said it would sell its fixed-wing corporate aircraft financing business in the Americas to Global Jet Capital  a provider of financing for the private aircraft market.

column4: General Mills recalls 1.8 million boxes of gluten-free Cheerios
column5: General Mills Inc is recalling 1.8 million boxes of gluten-free Cheerios cereal because they may contain wheat  which can cause adverse reactions in people with gluten allergies.

column4: UPDATE 1-General Mills recalls 1.8 mln boxes of gluten-free Cheerios
column5: Oct 5 General Mills Inc is recalling 1.8 million boxes of gluten-free Cheerios cereal because they may contain wheat  which can cause adverse reactions in people with gluten allergies.

column4: UPDATE 1-Goldcorp says work resumes at Argentina mine after union work halt
column5: Oct 5 Work has resumed at Goldcorp Inc's  Cerro Negro mine in Argentina  the company said on Monday  following the declaration of a mandatory 15-day conciliation period by the Santa Cruz Provincial Secretariat of Labor.

column4: Fed extends comment period for Goldman plan to buy part of GE Capital Bank
column5: WASHINGTON The Federal Reserve on Monday announced it was extending through Oct 30 the public comment period for an application by U.S. banking giant Goldman Sachs Group Inc  to acquire assets and liabilities from GE Capital Bank .

column4: Fed extends comment period for Goldman plan to buy part of GE Capital Bank

column4: RPT-UPDATE 3-U.S. says BP to pay $20 bln in fines for 2010 oil spill
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 5 BP Plc will pay more than $20 billion in fines to resolve nearly all claims from its deadly Gulf of Mexico oil spill five years ago  marking the largest corporate settlement of its kind in U.S. history  Attorney General Loretta Lynch said on Monday.

Futures for the euro zone's blue-chip Euro STOXX 50 index were up by 2.2 percent  while futures on Germany's DAX  France's CAC and Britain's FTSE 100 were up by around 2 percent.
